Name: Squatting baboon
Description: The squatting baboon was thought by the ancient Egyptians to be worshipping the sun because the herd greets the beginning of a new day with loud cries. The ape is also the symbol and incarnation of the god Thoth, the god of wisdom and science. In this capacity he is the patron of officials and scribes.The bronze figure depicts an upright squatting baboon with a lunar crescent on his head. The body is finely modelled and attached to a pedestal with two sloping steps at the front and surrounded by a torus moulding at the top.
